string-array.name: cheese_descriptions
string-array.item: Brie is a soft French cheese with a creamy texture and rich, buttery flavor. Its white, bloomy rind is completely edible and adds an earthy, mushroom-like taste. The interior becomes increasingly creamy as it ripens, making it perfect for spreading on crusty bread or crackers.

Burrata is a fresh Italian cheese made from mozzarella and cream. The outer shell is solid mozzarella, while the inside contains stracciatella and cream, giving it a unique, creamy texture. Best enjoyed fresh at room temperature.

Cabrales is a Spanish blue cheese made from mixed milk (cow, goat, and sheep). It has a strong, pungent flavor with a creamy yet crumbly texture. Aged in natural caves, it develops distinctive blue-green veining throughout.

Camembert is a soft-ripened French cheese with a white, bloomy rind. Similar to Brie but with a more intense flavor, it has a creamy texture that becomes runny when fully ripe. Perfect for baking or enjoying with wine.

Cheddar is a hard English cheese that ranges from mild to extra sharp. It has a firm texture and develops a more complex, tangy flavor as it ages. One of the world\'s most popular cheeses, excellent for cooking or eating on its own.

Chevre is a French goat cheese with a distinctive tangy flavor and smooth, creamy texture. Often served fresh, it can be spread on bread or used in salads. Some varieties are aged to develop a firmer texture and more complex taste.
Colby is an American cheese similar to cheddar but with a milder flavor and more open texture. It\'s semi-hard with a slightly sweet taste, making it popular for sandwiches and snacking.

Cottage cheese is a fresh cheese curd product with a mild flavor and lumpy texture. It\'s low in fat and high in protein, making it popular for healthy eating. Often eaten plain or used in cooking and baking.
Emmental is a Swiss cheese famous for its holes (called eyes). It has a nutty, slightly sweet flavor and firm texture. Excellent for melting, it\'s commonly used in fondue and French onion soup.

Garrotxa is a Spanish goat cheese with a distinctive grayish rind. It has a creamy texture with a subtle, earthy flavor that becomes more complex with age. The rind is edible and adds to the cheese\'s unique character.

Gouda is a Dutch cheese with a rich, nutty flavor that intensifies with age. Young Gouda is mild and creamy, while aged varieties become hard and develop caramel notes. Excellent for both cooking and eating.

Gruyère is a Swiss cheese with a complex, nutty flavor and smooth texture. Essential for fondue and French onion soup, it melts beautifully and has a distinctive taste that pairs well with white wines.
Havarti is a Danish cheese with a buttery, slightly tangy flavor and creamy texture. It\'s semi-soft and melts well, making it perfect for sandwiches, cooking, or enjoying with crackers.

Manchego is a Spanish sheep\'s milk cheese with a distinctive zigzag pattern on its rind. It has a firm texture and nutty, slightly salty flavor. Often served with membrillo (quince paste) in Spanish cuisine.
Mascarpone is an Italian cream cheese with a rich, sweet flavor and smooth, spreadable texture. Essential for tiramisu, it\'s also used in both sweet and savory dishes as a luxurious ingredient.

Mozzarella is a fresh Italian cheese with a mild flavor and characteristic stretchy texture. Perfect for pizza and caprese salad, it\'s best enjoyed fresh and is known for its excellent melting properties.

Mozzarella di Bufala is the premium version made from water buffalo milk. It has a more complex flavor and creamier texture than regular mozzarella, with a slightly tangy finish that makes it prized by food enthusiasts.

Parmesan (Parmigiano-Reggiano) is the king of Italian cheeses. Hard and granular with a sharp, complex flavor, it\'s aged for at least 12 months. Essential for pasta dishes and excellent for grating over various foods.
Pecorino Romano is a hard Italian sheep\'s milk cheese with a sharp, salty flavor. Often used grated over pasta, it has a granular texture and distinctive taste that\'s more intense than Parmesan.

Roquefort is a French blue cheese made exclusively from sheep\'s milk. It has a tangy, sharp flavor with a creamy, crumbly texture. Aged in natural caves, it develops characteristic blue veining and a distinctive taste.
